p: Recently, Kanekiyo et al. developed a novel immunosubversion strategy by enhancing the avidity of immunogens to cross-reactive B cells (Fig.Â 4C) (Kanekiyo et al. 2019). Heterotypic influenza hemagglutinin antigens were co-localized on a single nanoparticle, generating a mosaic array. After vaccination, the avidity advantage of conserved epitopes to B cells can be achieved over strain-specific B cells, i.e., the B cell responses can adaptively target conserved antigenic surfaces, promoting cross-reactive antibody secretion. This heterotypic mosaic nanoparticle immunogen provides a new tool to combat viral genetic plasticity and antigenic variation.
